attributes.action: Release specimen papers and grade boundaries for English GCSE's
attributes.additional_details:
AQA exam board for GCSE
They haven't released anything for any teacher in the whole country to go by, and this is a massive disadvantage to all students as we don't know what our work is graded at and what to tell colleges and sixth forms for when we leave school in 2/3 months time.
attributes.background:
Sat in year 11 and I don't know anything about English GCSE's. We are getting our work marked at a B/A grade but it's coming back as a level 2/3.
I personally think this is a disgrace as I've sat year 11 being older than everyone else and I'm still struggling to figure out what I'm expected.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of AQA, not the UK Government and Parliament. 

AQA has provided some assessment resources on its website: http://www.aqa.org.uk/subjects/english/gcse/english-language-8700/assessment-resources

You can find information on the grade descriptors here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/grade-descriptors-for-gcses-graded-9-to-1/grade-descriptors-for-gcses-graded-9-to-1-english-language
